title: Deutsche Bank named Germany’s best corporate bank
body:
Deutsche Bank has been named best corporate bank in Germany by an annual survey conducted by German magazine FINANCE for the second year running. Their industry survey focuses on senior employees in finance departments of German companies, with 70 percent of respondents working for companies with an annual turnover of over 250 million euros.
This year, 177 people responded to the survey and placed Deutsche Bank first in the following categories:
Best bank in corporate banking
#1 House Bank
#1 Cash Management/Payment Transactions
#1 Trade and Export Finance
Best advice on DCM business/bond placements
Best advice on ECM business/IPOs
Best M&A advice
Best ESG advice
“As Deutsche Bank we aim to be the Global Hausbank for our clients. We are very grateful for again having been named top corporate bank in Germany by our clients. This is a true testament to our ambitions and a great recognition for all the entire Deutsche Bank team,” said Jan-Philipp Gillmann, Head of Corporate Bank Germany and Europe and Global Head of Corporate Coverage.
